document.docOrigin: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society 147 (2)
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of Paradoris sea slugs (Mollusca, Gastropoda, Nudibranchia, Doridina)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of Paradoris sea slugs (Mollusca, Gastropoda, Nudibranchia, Doridina)
Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Discodoris erythraeensis Vayssière, 1912: 23–24
, figs 150–152. –
Gohar & Abul-Ela, 1959: 52–59
, plate I, fig. 3, plate III, figs 1–3.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Additional material dissected:
South Africa , eastern side of the Cape Peninsula , Venus Pool ,
6 January 1980
, one specimen approximately 17/ 10 mm preserved, identified as
Discodoris sp.
by T. M. Gosliner ( SAM A32370 )
[this specimen is the voucher of
Discodoris sp. 1
Gosliner, 1987 ; it was dissected prior to the present study; the radula and the jaws were mounted on two permanent slides available with the specimen; however, the slides have dried and are not fully informative];
TANZANIA , off Dar-es-Salaam , Mbudya ,
7 September 1977
, two specimens 14/9 (#1) and 8/4 (#2) mm preserved, [leg. unknown], identified as
Discodoris
by T. M. Gosliner ( CASIZ 074477 )
;
Tanzania , Mtwara Region , Msimbati ,
30 m depth
,
1 November 1994
, one specimen 14/ 9 mm , leg. T. M. Gosliner , identified as
Discodoris
by T. M. Gosliner ( CASIZ 099390 )
;
PHILIPPINES , Luzon , Batangas Province , Maricaban Island , Bethlehem ,
8 May 2001
, 10 m depth, one specimen 20/ 11 mm preserved, leg. T. M. Gosliner , identified as
Discodoris
by T. M. Gosliner ( CASIZ 157029 )
.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 17. Live animals (except for D). A,
Paradoris erythraeensis , CASIZ
157029, total length (preserved) = 20 mm. B,
P. erythraeensis , SAM A
32370, total length (preserved) = 17 mm. C,
P. erythraeensis , CASIZ
099390, total length (preserved) = 14 mm. D,
P. liturata
, dorsal view of the holotype, after Bergh (1905 : plate XIV, fig. 15), total length (preserved) = 14 mm. E,
P. liturata , CASIZ
097595 (probably #2), total length (preserved) = 27 (#2) mm. F,
P. liturata , CASIZ
069612, total length (preserved) = 12 mm. G,
P. liturata , CASIZ
113658, total length (preserved) = 16 mm. H,
P. liturata
, picture from CASIZ slide collection (specimen not found). Colour pictures by T.M. Gosliner.

Figure 18.
Paradoris erythraeensis
, holotype, MNHN. A, general view of the reproductive system, scale = 3 mm. B, distal part of the reproductive system with two accessory glands and one stylet sac, scale = 1.4 mm. C, one lateral jaw plate and the ventral jaw plate (the second lateral plate was missing), scale = 1.4 mm. D, mantle holes, scale = 0.7 mm.

Figure 19.
Paradoris erythraeensis
. A, anterior, ventral view, CASIZ 157029, scale = 3.4 mm. B, mantle holes, CASIZ 157029, scale = 0.7 mm. C, dorsal view, CASIZ 157029, scale = 5 mm. D, mantle holes, MNHN-Amer #1, scale = 0.9 mm. E, mantle holes and minute pigmentation, CASIZ 074477 #1, scale = 1.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Questionable and immature
additional material dissected:
[SUEZ CANAL], lac Amer , [collecting date unknown], two specimens 17/11 (#1) and 10/8 (#2) mm preserved, leg. Gruvel , identified as
D. erythraeensis
by A. Pruvot-Fol ( MNHN , no catalogue number) [the largest specimen (#1) was entirely dissected prior to the present study; no internal organs remain in the jar except for some pieces of the reproductive system – the prostate, part of the female gland mass, and the spermatic pouches are missing; the small specimen (#2) was also dissected prior to the present study; its reproductive system, either naturally absent or extracted by a previous worker, could not be found; I refer to these specimens as MNHN-Amer in order to avoid confusion with the
holotype , also held by the MNHN]; THAILAND , Gulf of Thailand, Ko-Sichang , Hin- Tasan ,
17 August 1966
, one specimen 14/ 7 mm preserved, leg. F. B. Steiner , identified as
Discodoris
by T. M. Gosliner ( CASIZ 081807 )
;
INDONESIA , Malay Archipelago , Lesser Sunda Islands , Adonara Island , south end of island,
28 November 1995
, one specimen 15/ 7 mm preserved, leg. Pauline Fiene , identified as
Discodoris
by T. M. Gosliner ( CASIZ 109846 )
.
